title: Deputies say 16-year-old shot 11-year-old brother
content:
Please install the latest Adobe Flash Player Plugin to watch this content.
Everett, Wash. - A 16-year-old Snohomish County boy appeared in court Monday. Deputies say he shot his 11-year-old brother.
Kyle Alcorn and his neighbors at the Barisa Apartments near Everett were on edge just after noon Sunday.
"Concerning," said Alcorn, "Because there's kids here."
A swarm of Snohomish County Sheriff's deputies descended on their neighborhood on the hunt for a shooter.
"They were searching for them," said Alcorn. "They've been out for miles and they were still searching."
But while deputies and their K-9 units were looking for the suspect, they got word they were on the wrong track.
"They determined that in fact, no one had fled," said Snohomish County Sheriff's Lt. David Bowman. "That the young boy had been shot by an older brother."
And that the older brother, 16, was still inside the apartment in Building K.
"The sibling is being talked to by deputies and detectives," said Lt. Bowman.
The victim was transported to Harborview Medical Center in critical condition. At least one parent accompanied him to Seattle. Monday morning, he was in serious condition.
Deputies spent all afternoon trying to figure out what led to the shooting.
Then just before 6 p.m. Sunday came word that the older brother was under arrest; that the community has nothing to fear.
"We know who was involved," said Lt. Bowman. "And in this case there's no further danger to the public."
Deputies have not given a motive.
The teenaged brother is being held at the Denny Youth Center in Everett on reckless endangerment and unlawful possession of a firearm charges.
